comments:
Using I-I20051007-200510070202 

I had a dynamic web project with some product server adapter defined, which 
I did not actually have on my machine. 

I went to delete it, defined another, etc., and seemed no matter what I did, 
could not get the "build path" property page. Kept getting NPE's.

The log had exception stack ending with ... 
!STACK 0
java.lang.NullPointerException
        at
org.eclipse.jst.server.core.internal.RuntimeClasspathContainer.getDescription(RuntimeClasspathContainer.java:68)
        at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.wizards.buildpaths.CPListLabelProvider.getCPListElementText(CPListLabelProvider.java:254)
        at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.wizards.buildpaths.CPListLabelProvider.getText(CPListLabelProvider.java:75)
        at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.wizards.buildpaths.CPListElementSorter.compare(CPListElementSorter.java:84)
        at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.ViewerSorter$1.compare(ViewerSorter.java:177)
        at java.util.Arrays.mergeSort(Arrays.java:1278)
        at java.util.Arrays.sort(Arrays.java:1219)
        at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.ViewerSorter.sort(ViewerSorter.java:175)


The properties dialog had a tell-tale message (I've replaced name and version 
with xyz and nnn to protect the innocent :) 

    Build path entry is missing: org.ecl...bXYZ Application Server vNNN JRE


Does the base JDT functionality need more guards?

JDT could probably use more guards for bad code downstream to be more robust,
but this was an NPE in the server code. Fix tagged for the next I-build.
